00036 class SpecPxCache {
00037 public:
00038    SpecPxCache(int cacheLen)
00039    {
00040       len = cacheLen;
00041       values = new float[len];
00042       valid = false;
00043    }
00044 
00045    ~SpecPxCache()
00046    {
00047       delete[] values;
00048    }
00049 
00050    sampleCount  len;
00051    float       *values;
00052    bool         valid;
00053 };

00060 class AUDACITY_DLL_API WaveClip: public XMLTagHandler
00061 {
00062 private:
00063    WaveClip(const WaveClip&)
00064    {
00065       wxMessageBox(wxT("Fatal error - please report to audacity-devel@lists.sourceforge.net\n"));
00066    }
00067 
00068 public:
00069    // typical constructor
00070    WaveClip(DirManager *projDirManager, sampleFormat format, int rate);
00071 
00072    // essentially a copy constructor - but you must pass in the
00073    // current project's DirManager, because we might be copying
00074    // from one project to another
00075    WaveClip(WaveClip& orig, DirManager *projDirManager);

00083    
00084    // Set rate without resampling. This will change the length of the clip
00085    void SetRate(int rate);
00086    
00087    // Resample clip. This also will set the rate, but without changing
00088    // the length of the clip
00089    bool Resample(int rate, ProgressDialog *progress = NULL);
00090    
00091    void SetOffset(double offset);
00092    double GetOffset() const { return mOffset; }
00093    void Offset(double delta) { SetOffset(GetOffset() + delta); }
00094    double GetStartTime() const;
00095    double GetEndTime() const;
00096    sampleCount GetStartSample() const;
00097    sampleCount GetEndSample() const;
00098    sampleCount GetNumSamples() const { return mSequence->GetNumSamples(); }
00099 
00100    // One and only one of the following is true for a given t (unless the clip
00101    // has zero length -- then BeforeClip() and AfterClip() can both be true).
00102    // Within() is true if the time is substantially within the clip
00103    bool WithinClip(double t) const;
00104    bool BeforeClip(double t) const;
00105    bool AfterClip(double t) const;

00116    // but use more high-level functions inside WaveClip (or add them if you
00117    // think they are useful for general use)
00118    Sequence* GetSequence() { return mSequence; }
